1_summer_break_choice: ^The final bell of the semester rings, signaling the start of summer break.
^As your classmates burst into excited chatter, you,
^, quietly pack your bag, ready to slip away unnoticed.
^@Kaori: GUUUUYYYYYS! YOU WON'T BELIEVE WHAT I FOUND! IT'S THE PERFECT OF THE PERFECT-EST (?) PLACE!
^Kaori bursts into the classroom like a whirlwind, her eyes practically sparkling like stars, and a crumpled newspaper clutched victoriously in her hand.

c-0: ^You raise your head, wondering what chaos Kaori's bringing this time.
c-1: ^You keep your head down, but your ears perk up anyway - it's impossible not to hear Kaori.
g-0: ^Kaori's gaze sweeps the room like a searchlight, landing on you and your usual squad: Airi (the worrier), Kanae (the voice of reason), Ryu (the adventurer), and Haruto (the peacekeeper).
^@Kaori: Why don't we visit this SUPER AWESOME shrine for a test of courage? There might even be hidden treasure!
^@Airi: A shrine... a treasure... what? Slow down!
^@Haruto: Kaori, remember breathing? That thing humans need to do?
^@Kaori: Pffft, breathing is overrated when you've got NEWS THIS BIG!
^@Kaori: Ya'll know that spooky abandoned amusement park by the ocean in Ukiyo? Well, there's this HUGE beach on the northern side.
^@Kaori: It's like, BOOM - mountains! SPLASH - ocean! And right there, this amazing old shrine just sitting at the top of this hill! And get this - it's TOTALLY haunted!
g-1: ^@Kaori: The stairs to the shrine? They start RIGHT AT THE BEACH! It's like something straight outta those magical girl animes!

c-5: ^: Let her be excited! This actually sounds super cool!

g-2: ^@Kaori: Back in ye olden days, this wasn't just any shrine - it was THE shrine! They had this super special miko who'd do this crazy ritual called "Kagura Yume" - but only once every hundred years!
^@Kaori: Legend says the chosen miko could literally WALK ON WATER! Like, not just a little hop-skip - full-on water-walking!
^@Kaori: And get this - the water would GLOW wherever she stepped! People came from EVERYWHERE to see it! How cool is that?!

c-6: ^: But isn't it, like, super off-limits?
^@Kaori: That's what makes it EXTRA exciting, Aie!
c-7: ^You try to become one with your chair, hoping to avoid the incoming chaos.

g-3: ^@Kaori: SO! Test of courage time! Who's in?!
^@Ryu: Count me in! Better than sitting at home playing games all break!
^@Kanae: *sigh* Someone needs to keep you all from doing anything TOO stupid...
^@Airi: I-I mean... if everyone's going... I might as well join.
^All eyes turn to you like spotlights.
^@Kaori: C'mon Aie! It'll be the BEST THING EVER! Pretty please?

c-8: ^: You know what? Let's do this!
c-9: ^@Haruto: Hey, we'll all be there together!

convince_player: ^@Airi: Look, I'm scared of my own shadow sometimes, but even I'm going!
^@Ryu: Think of the STORIES we'll have! We'll be LEGENDS!

c-0: ^: When you put it that way... okay!
c-1: ^@Kaori: Wait wait! I have an idea!

talisman_option: ^@Kaori: What if we bring lucky talismans? My grandma has these SUPER POWERFUL ones!

c-1: ^: A piece of paper won't help if the floor collapses...
^@Kaori: Aww, please? We really want you there!

final_decision: ^The group looks at you expectantly. This is your last chance to decide.

c-0: ^: Okay, I'll come. But promise we'll be careful?
^@Kaori: Of course! We'll stick together and watch out for each other.
c-1: ^: I'm sorry, but I really can't. Have fun without me.
^The group looks disappointed, but they respect your decision.

group_planning: ^@Kaori: Alright! Let's meet at the entrance of the park tomorrow at dusk. Don't forget to bring your flashlights!
^As your friends chatter excitedly about tomorrow's adventure, you feel a mix of anticipation and anxiety. What awaits you at the shrine?
^@Ryu: Hey, Aie, you okay? You look a bit pale.

c-0: ^: Just a little nervous, I guess. This is pretty out of my comfort zone.
^@Airi: Don't worry, we'll all look out for each other. Right, everyone?
c-1: ^: I'm fine. Just thinking about what to pack.
g-0: ^@Haruto: That's the spirit! Maybe bring some snacks to share?

c-2: ^You decide to pack some instant ramen and hot water before you leave tomorrow.
c-3: ^: I don't think we need snacks as we won't be there for long?
^You decide to skip on packing snacks.

g-1: ^@Kanae: Should we bring anything else? First aid kit maybe?
^@Kaori: Good thinking, Kanae! Aie, since you're good at planning, why don't you make a list of things we should bring?

c-4: ^: Sure, I can do that. Better to be prepared, I suppose.
c-5: ^: Uh, maybe someone else should do it? I'm not sure what we'd need.
^@Airi: No problem, I can handle it. But feel free to add any ideas, Aie!

g-2: ^As the group continues to plan, you can't help but wonder if you've made the right decision. But seeing your friends' excitement, a small part of you starts to look forward to the adventure.
^@Kaori: This is going to be the best summer break ever! See you all tomorrow!
^The group disperses, leaving you with your thoughts about the upcoming test of courage.

solo_ending: ^You head home alone, feeling a mix of relief and regret. As you settle in for a quiet evening, your phone buzzes with messages from your friends.
^@Kaori: We'll miss you tomorrow, Aie! But we understand. Maybe next time?
^@Airi: Take care, Aie. We'll tell you all about it when we get back.
^@Ryu: Your loss, buddy! But hey, if you change your mind, you know where to find us!

c-0: ^: Have fun, guys. Be safe out there.

b: ^ You add some safety reminders about bringing first aid kits and checking the weather.

c-1: ^You set your phone aside, trying to ignore the pang of regret.

b:
^As night falls, you feel confident in your decision.

^Ghost stories are just stories, and abandoned buildings are genuinely dangerous. Better to be smart than sorry.

^You can't help but wonder if you're missing out on something extraordinary.

^What if the legends about the shrine are true? Still, some mysteries might be better left unexplored.
^The stories about the shrine nag at your mind - whether true or not, they hold an undeniable allure.

^The thought of your friends experiencing this adventure without you leaves an empty feeling in your chest.

^Maybe next time you'll be braver.

^You remind yourself that safety comes first.

^Abandoned buildings are dangerous, regardless of any supernatural elements.

^You wonder if you've made the right choice. Part of you wishes you were braver, while another part is glad to be safe at home.

^Your mind keeps wandering back to the mysteries of the shrine. What secrets might it hold? What stories could be waiting to be discovered?

^You spend a large portion of the evening researching the shrine's history online, focusing on old newspaper articles and academic papers about its cultural significance.

^While skeptical of supernatural claims, you're intrigued by the documented architectural details and historical ceremonies.

^The logical part of your mind suggests there must be rational explanations behind the legends - perhaps clever engineering or natural phenomena.

^As night approaches, you find yourself drawn into research about ancient Shinto practices and sacred sites.

^The stories about the "Kagura Yume" ritual and its connection to the shrine fill you with a mix of excitement and reverence.

^Each account of supernatural encounters sends a peculiar thrill through you - equal parts fear and fascination.

^You spend the evening doing general research about the shrine, trying to separate fact from fiction.

^While the supernatural stories are intriguing, you're more interested in understanding its historical significance.

^The shrine's mysteries consume your thoughts. You sketch rough maps based on old photographs, marking points of interest.

^Every article leads to new questions, and you carefully note them all down, hoping to find answers tomorrow.

^Your phone lights up constantly with messages from the group chat.

^@Kaori: Don't forget your flashlights everyone!

^@Ryu: Already packed mine! Anyone bringing extra batteries?

^@Airi: I've got spares! We can share!

^Their enthusiasm is contagious, making even the daunting aspects of tomorrow feel more like an exciting shared adventure.
^You approach your preparation with methodical precision, creating detailed checklists and contingency plans.
^ The talisman rests carefully wrapped on your desk - a spiritual safeguard, regardless of your beliefs.
^Your research into the area's terrain and weather patterns helps you pack appropriately.
^ The carefully chosen snacks and thermal supplies are arranged nearby - you've read enough adventure stories to know that shared food can lift spirits in tense moments.

2_packing: ^The evening light filters through your window, casting amber shadows across your preparation space. Each item you consider carries its own weight of possibility and purpose.

b: ^Your supplies are arranged with tactical consideration: flashlight with backup batteries, a detailed map of the area marked with potential hazards
^Each item has been chosen based on careful risk assessment and practical necessity.

^Your research materials spread across your desk tell their own story - printouts of historical photographs, notes about local legends, and carefully marked topographical maps.

^You've even found old maintenance records from the shrine's active years, offering potential insights into its layout.

c-0: ^After careful consideration, you opt for minimalist efficiency: a reliable flashlight, your fully-charged phone, and a small water bottle.
^Sometimes, you reason, mobility and simplicity are their own forms of preparation.
c-1: ^Your backpack gradually fills with carefully considered items: flashlight with spare batteries
^, backup power bank, water supplies, weather-appropriate gear.
^Each addition represents a calculated response to potential scenarios.

b:
^The thermal flask and selection of snacks are packed strategically at the top for easy access.

^You remember to include enough to share - food has a way of bringing people together in uncertain situations.

^The talisman receives special consideration. You wrap it carefully in traditional cloth before placing it in a secure pocket.

^Its presence provides a curious comfort - a bridge between rational preparation and spiritual protection.

g-0: ^As darkness settles, you perform one final inventory check, mentally walking through various scenarios.

b:
^The evening shadows seem to hold new meaning now, dancing at the edge of your vision like playful spirits.

^You catch yourself wondering if the shrine's ancient guardians are aware of tomorrow's visitors, and what welcome they might prepare.

^You ground yourself in facts and probabilities, reviewing structural safety concerns and weather forecasts.

^Ghost stories may be fiction, but abandoned structures pose real challenges that demand respect and preparation.

^The night brings a mix of practical concerns and imaginative wonderings about what tomorrow might hold.

^Whether the shrine's mysteries are natural or supernatural, they deserve careful consideration.

g-0: ^Sleep proves elusive as your mind traces the path you'll take tomorrow - from the weathered steps at the shore's edge to the mysterious heights of the ancient shrine.

3_walk_to_gate: ^The next evening arrives with an ethereal glow, the setting sun painting the sky in shades of amber and rose.

b:
^You arrive at the park entrance to find your friends already gathered, their excitement palpable in the twilight air.

^@Kaori: THERE YOU ARE! We were starting to worry!

^@Airi: We just got here too, don't listen to her.
^You arrive at the park entrance right on time. The others trickle in gradually, their usual energy somewhat subdued by the approaching darkness.
^You double-check your supplies one last time, ensuring everything is secure and accessible.
^@Kanae: Always the prepared one, aren't you?
^ The weight of the first-aid kit provides a reassuring presence against your back.

3_walk_to_gate: ^The abandoned amusement park looms before you, its rusted gates standing sentinel against the darkening sky. Beyond them, barely visible, the mountain's silhouette rises against the horizon.

c-0: ^: No point standing here. Let's go.
^You step forward, pushing gently against the old gate.
c-1: ^: Maybe we should review the plan one more time?
^@Kaori: The plan is simple - we follow the path to the beach, then take the shrine stairs up!
g-0: ^The gate creaks open with a sound that seems to echo through the empty park. Your flashlight beams cut through the growing darkness, creating dancing shadows among the abandoned attractions.

b: ^The air feels different here - heavier somehow, charged with an energy that makes the hair on your arms stand up.
^ You touch the talisman in your pocket, drawing comfort from its presence.

^You focus on practical concerns - watching for loose ground, rusty metal, anything that could pose a real danger.

^The "spooky" atmosphere is just your mind playing tricks in the low light.
^The air feels different here - heavier somehow, charged with an energy that makes the hair on your arms stand up.
^ You touch the talisman in your pocket, drawing comfort from its presence.

g-0: ^@Haruto: The beach access should be this way, past the old carousel.

b: ^: Anyone want a snack before we head down?
^@Airi: Maybe later? I'm too nervous to eat right now.
^@Ryu: Save them for when we reach the shrine!

g-0: ^As you make your way through the park, the sound of waves grows steadily louder, a rhythmic pulse that seems to match your heartbeat.

b: ^Your research comes flooding back as you pass each landmark. The carousel, installed in 1952, was once the pride of the park. The rusted tracks of the mountain coaster snake up into the darkness, their path to the shrine now overgrown.
^: Did you know this place used to attract thousands of visitors every summer?
^@Kanae: Really? It's hard to imagine now...

c-2: ^You keep your attention on the ground, watching for hazards in the beam of your flashlight.
^The beach stairs should be just ahead, beyond the old gift shop.
c-3: ^The abandoned park holds a strange beauty in the twilight. Moonlight glints off broken windows and rusted metal, creating an otherworldly scene.
^You can almost imagine echoes of past laughter carried on the sea breeze.

g-1: ^The group falls quiet as you approach the beach access point. Ancient wooden stairs, weathered by decades of salt air, descend into darkness.
^@Airi: Those steps don't look very stable...

b: ^: We should test each step before putting our full weight on it. And stay close to the railing.
^The others nod, appreciating your practical approach.

g-1: ^The shrine's presence feels stronger now, though it remains hidden in the darkness above. Only the first few stairs are visible in your flashlight beams, the rest disappearing into the night like a path into another world.
